titleInfo.title: Notice. -- The Proclamation through the Newspapers of This City in March Last.

mods.abstract: NOTICE. -- THE PROCLAMATION through the newspapers of this city in March last, offering a reward of Twenty-five Dollars, and by hand-bills posted through the streets offering One Hundred and Fifty Dollars Reward, for the arrest of a Negro man slave named HENRY, purchased by me of JAMES M. BOAZMAN and others, who had escaped from my possession, is hereby revoked, retructed and made null and void ; the boy not having been delivered to me, and having disposed of him, or rather compelled the parties from whom he was purchased by law to rescind the contract, in consequence of his unsoundness. I hereby cancel he offer heretofore made for his recovery. WM. H. NIXON. New Orleans, January 12, 1854. jan12
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
